Articles.Content:
Hello guys and girls!

IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been wandering in the Spacecraft Exchange for a while and I didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t see many lifters, so I decided to share with you mine. 

The Say My Name are a low part, asparagus staging lifters, we have nine rockets that can put your payload of 5t, 10t, 20t, 40t, 60t (new), 80t, 100t, 120t (new), 150t (new) in a stable LKO of 80km. They are pretty, robust and most important they do their job! ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

Some helpful information. All the rockets are tested in suboptimal flights for the players that who doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have much piloting skills (like me :/) use the lifters without too much problem. And be careful with the heaviest ones they are way trickier than a thought to put in orbit. Always put struts, for reducing the wobble on the heaviest and taller, you can put struts in your payload and connect then all way down in the lifter. Read the In-game descripitions for details of the tests with payloads 

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/fTH5x)

> 
>  SMN I, II, III, IV 
> 
> Changed the design a little because the TWR was too high in the first stages.
> 
> SMN VI, VII 
> 
> Added some struts and changed fins for increase stability, it increase the part count (obvious!) but they still less than a hundred parts. 
> 
> SMN V, VIII, IX New lifters, how cool is that?

[Dowload in Google drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6GFBbOg6Hr7VGNuelBWQnRVQkU/view?usp=docslist_api)

Peace.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-09T15:46:54Z" title="08/09/2015 03:46  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 9, 2015</time> by Zais**
  
New rockets and more information

Welcome to the forums, Zais! I really like your class of lifters - Designed really well! I also like the payload capacities. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Repped!

Thanks, I really aprreciate your feedback, currently I'm adjusting the TWR (since they are too high) and doing some tweaks in the lifters.

It's seems that will be a Mk2 of the SMN. In the worst case scenario I'll update on sunday since the tests take too many time and I'm not a pro on piloting skills. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Peace.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-07T23:18:55Z" title="08/07/2015 11:18  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 7, 2015</time> by Zais**
